config.question: Which of the following statements is true about the Watergate scandal?

choices.content: Nixon was charged with contempt of Congress.
Congress was complicit in the suppression of the scandal.
It resulted in the impeachment of President Nixon.
It was handled without recourse to the Supreme Court.

answer_3.response: When Nixon tried to release only a few of the less damaging tapes, the Supreme Court ruled unanimously in July 1974 that the tapes had to be turned over to the prosecutor. By that time, the House Judiciary Committee had voted three articles of impeachment, charging Nixon with obstruction of justice, abuse of power, and contempt of Congress. Nixon’s resignation proved to be the culmination of the Watergate scandal.
